content.question:
There is no snow on Janet's driveway when snow begins to fall at midnight. From midnight to 9 A.M., snow accumulates on the driveway at a rate modeled by f(t) = 7tecos t cubic feet per hour, where t is measured in hours since midnight. Janet starts removing snow at 6 A.M. (t = 6). The rate g(t), in cubic feet per hour, at which Janet removes snow from the driveway at time t hours after midnight is modeled by

<math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>125</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>108</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>6</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>9.</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>

(a) How many cubic feet of snow have accumulated on the driveway by 6 A.M.?

frqParts.text:
There is no snow on Janet's driveway when snow begins to fall at midnight. From midnight to 9 A.M., snow accumulates on the driveway at a rate modeled by f(t) = 7tecos t cubic feet per hour, where t is measured in hours since midnight. Janet starts removing snow at 6 A.M. (t = 6). The rate g(t), in cubic feet per hour, at which Janet removes snow from the driveway at time t hours after midnight is modeled by

<math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>125</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>108</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>6</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext>for </mtext> <mn>7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>9.</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>

(a) How many cubic feet of snow have accumulated on the driveway by 6 A.M.?
(b) Find the rate of change of the volume of snow on the driveway at 8 A.M.

(c) Let h(t) represent the total amount of snow, in cubic feet, that Janet has removed from the driveway at time t hours after midnight. Express h as a piecewise-defined function with domain <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaIWaGaeyizImQaamiDaiabgsMiJkaaiMdaaaa@3BF6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.
(d) How many cubic feet of snow are on the driveway at 9 A.M.?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
